channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Even megastars like Venus Williams get the health insurance blues
item.description: In the U.S., as nowhere else, health insurance and employment are deeply connected. And that means confusion can snare even elite athletes.
item.content:encoded:
In the U.S., as nowhere else, health insurance and employment are deeply connected. And that means confusion can snare even elite athletes.

(Image credit: Scott Taetsch)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Taiwanese voters reject a bid to remove lawmakers from a China-friendly party
item.description: The independence-leaning ruling Democratic Progressive Party won the last presidential election, but the China-friendly Nationalists and the Taiwan People's Party have enough seats to form a majority bloc.
item.content:encoded:
The independence-leaning ruling Democratic Progressive Party won the last presidential election, but the China-friendly Nationalists and the Taiwan People's Party have enough seats to form a majority bloc.

(Image credit: ChiangYing-ying/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: Ozzy Osbourne, no ordinary man
item.description: John Michael Osbourne, a poor student from Birmingham, UK, exceeded expectations and helped invent heavy metal. A moment to remember the singular Ozzy Osbourne, who died this week at the age of 76.
item.content:encoded:
John Michael Osbourne, a poor student from Birmingham, UK, exceeded expectations and helped invent heavy metal. A moment to remember the singular Ozzy Osbourne, who died this week at the age of 76.

(Image credit: Kevork Djansezian/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: 'We are being driven from the land' - after a massacre, a Nigerian village buries its dead
item.description: Another deadly overnight raid in central Nigeria left more than 100 villagers dead and hundreds displaced. Survivors in Benue State say it's part of a brutal campaign to drive Christian farming communities from their land. NPR reports from Yelwata, where residents are still counting the dead.
item.content:encoded:
Another deadly overnight raid in central Nigeria left more than 100 villagers dead and hundreds displaced. Survivors in Benue State say it's part of a brutal campaign to drive Christian farming communities from their land. NPR reports from Yelwata, where residents are still counting the dead.

(Image credit: Marvellous Durowaiye)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Primate pet ownership fuels a brutal industry. This bill could slow it down
item.description: For most pet primates in the United States, life is marked by chronic stress, malnutrition and illness — if they survive at all. A bill in Congress would aim to make ownership of captive primates illegal in all 50 states.
item.content:encoded:
For most pet primates in the United States, life is marked by chronic stress, malnutrition and illness — if they survive at all. A bill in Congress would aim to make ownership of captive primates illegal in all 50 states.

(Image credit: Oakland Zoo)
item.dc:creator: Stephanie O'Neill

item.title: Corporate America is having a weird tariff summer
item.description: Some big companies are reporting real financial pain from tariffs and economic uncertainty — but for others, business is booming.
item.content:encoded:
Some big companies are reporting real financial pain from tariffs and economic uncertainty — but for others, business is booming.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Home sales are down. So why are prices at an all-time high?
item.description: Those with equity in a home can trade up more easily, while many first-time homebuyers are still stuck on the sidelines.
item.content:encoded:
Those with equity in a home can trade up more easily, while many first-time homebuyers are still stuck on the sidelines.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Taiwan votes to decide whether to oust lawmakers from China-friendly party
item.description: Taiwanese voted in a recall election Saturday to determine whether to oust about one-fifth of their lawmakers, a vote that could potentially reshape the power balance in the self-ruled island's legislature.
item.content:encoded:
Taiwanese voted in a recall election Saturday to determine whether to oust about one-fifth of their lawmakers, a vote that could potentially reshape the power balance in the self-ruled island's legislature.

(Image credit: ChiangYing-ying)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Has the Billboard Hot 100 caught the Holy Ghost?
item.description: Brittany dives into the economy behind Christian contemporary music
item.content:encoded:
Brittany dives into the economy behind Christian contemporary music

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Corey Antonio Rose

item.title: Arizona woman to serve 8 years for identity theft scheme benefiting North Korea
item.description: Christina Chapman was sentenced to prison this week for her role in a scheme that the DOJ said used stolen American identities in order to help illegally employ North Koreans in U.S. companies.
item.content:encoded:
Christina Chapman was sentenced to prison this week for her role in a scheme that the DOJ said used stolen American identities in order to help illegally employ North Koreans in U.S. companies.

(Image credit: Peter Parks)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
